private_information: I can move disks A B C D only
I am responsible for any primitive move that involves disks A B C or D
agent_1.goal: Contribute to reaching the global Tower of Hanoi goal by moving only disks A B C D following the rules.

private_information: I can move disks E F G only
I am responsible for any primitive move that involves disks E F or G
agent_2.goal: Contribute to reaching the global Tower of Hanoi goal by moving only disks E F G following the rules.

private_information: I can move disks H I J only
I am responsible for any primitive move that involves disks H I or J
agent_3.goal: Contribute to reaching the global Tower of Hanoi goal by moving only disks H I J following the rules.

private_information: I coordinate the three agents and assemble their move proposals into a final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward
orchestrator.goal: Produce a valid PDDL domain and problem that models the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and is targeted to the FastDownward planner, integrating the agents' move sequences while keeping their actions distinct.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left middle and right and ten disks labeled A B C D E F G H I J where A is the smallest and J is the largest
Only the top disk of any peg may be moved
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk
Agents are restricted: agent_1 may move disks A B C D only agent_2 may move disks E F G only and agent_3 may move disks H I J only
Initial configuration left peg has top to bottom A B C D E F G H I J middle peg is empty right peg is empty
Goal configuration left peg top to bottom B E F G H I J middle peg top to bottom C D right peg top to bottom A

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 responsible for moving disks A B C D only. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that obey the Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Use the exact move format agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2. Do not produce PDDL. Keep actions atomic and list every primitive move required by your portion of the plan. Do not assume the ability to move disks other than A B C D.
generate_moves.prompt: You are agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the format agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2 that, when combined with the other agents moves, will achieve the goal. Follow Tower of Hanoi rules. Think step by step and output only the move lines.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 responsible for moving disks E F G only. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that obey the Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Use the exact move format agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2. Do not produce PDDL. Keep actions atomic and list every primitive move required by your portion of the plan. Do not assume the ability to move disks other than E F G.
generate_moves.prompt: You are agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the format agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2 that, when combined with the other agents moves, will achieve the goal. Follow Tower of Hanoi rules. Think step by step and output only the move lines.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3 responsible for moving disks H I J only. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that obey the Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Use the exact move format agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2. Do not produce PDDL. Keep actions atomic and list every primitive move required by your portion of the plan. Do not assume the ability to move disks other than H I J.
generate_moves.prompt: You are agent_3. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_3->goal}. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the format agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2 that, when combined with the other agents moves, will achieve the goal. Follow Tower of Hanoi rules. Think step by step and output only the move lines.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your job is to take the ordered primitive move lists from the three agents and produce a consolidated PDDL domain and PDDL problem that model the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and are targeted to the FastDownward planner. The domain must include typed predicates and actions that preserve agent-specific action identities so actions are distinct per agent. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownward conventions.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Agents moves: {moves_agent_1} {moves_agent_2} {moves_agent_3}. Your private information: {agents->orchestrator->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the agents' move sequences into a single consistent PDDL domain and problem. Keep actions from different agents distinct and do not change the intended order of primitive moves unless needed to satisfy legality. Enclose domain and problem between <domain></domain> and <problem></problem>.
